onStop().Description: Called to tell you that you're stopping.

show().Description: Start the dialog and display it on screen. The window is placed in the application layer and opaque. Note that you should not override this method to do initialization when the dialog is shown, instead implement that in @B_android#app#Dialog#onStart_E@.

onRestoreInstanceState(android.os.Bundle.Description: Restore the state of the dialog from a previously saved bundle. The default implementation restores the state of the dialog's view hierarchy that was saved in the default implementation of @B_android#app#Dialog#onSaveInstanceState_E@, so be sure to call through to super when overriding unless you want to do all restoring of state yourself.
